summary: Implement a backend-saved mod on/off toggle so the same toggle state loads consistently across all devices, including consoles.
architectural_notes: Store mod enable/disable toggle state on backend to ensure consistent value across devices (including consoles).

existing_features.title: Persist each mod’s enabled/disabled state in the backend so that when the mod creator toggles the mod on/off on one device, the same enabled state is returned when the creator opens the app on any other device (including consoles).

On the mod management page, render a mod on/off toggle UI directly below the existing share link section; the toggle must load the current enabled state from the backend and update it via a backend mutation.
On the public mod page, handle disabled mods gracefully by showing an English “mod unavailable/disabled” message instead of broken UI when the backend denies access because the mod is disabled.

new_feature_requests.summary: Persist mod on/off toggle state in backend so all devices (including consoles) load the same value.
Enforce access control for enabled-state operations: only the mod creator (or an admin) can read or update a mod’s enabled/disabled state by modId.
When a mod is disabled, block public/unlisted access so that requests to fetch a mod by unlistedId do not return the mod/files while disabled.

projectName: Persist mod on/off toggle so all devices load the same state
